Erm I don't think McDonalds is 'true original' Singaporean anything, to begin with, Samster SG. Besides, going by your theory, this means that McDonalds came to Singapore to "go all out to attract the expatriate American customers". And what about the Samurai burger? For the Japanese expats? And goodness knows how many other recipes have fallen into that category. Why can't we just enjoy the variety that McDonalds provides? It's not like they took away the Big Mac to make way for something else. And as for the McAloo Tikki, why is it just for the Indian expats? Local Indians can't appreciate it too? 12.post_text:
Dear Customers,
We know many of you are concerned about the recent post on a customer’s experience with the Sausage McMuffin. We have just received the preliminary lab results, which shows that the sample collected is 100% chicken. The item in question in the picture, is actually a chicken blood vein. The vein is white in colour because of the Halal slaughtering process where blood had to be drained. Food safety is our top priority and we take all feedback relating to the quality of our food very seriously. Our chicken sausage patty is actually made from minced dark and white chicken meat, and the patties are imported from Malaysia. We have also traced back the product’s production process and no product from the same batch had any quality issues reported. We thank all the loyal customers who have supported us and allowed us time to present the facts. Please rest assured that we make no compromises when it comes to the safety of our food.

Too much carbohydrate.  Bread carbohydrate, potato carbohydrate if you buy set worse still french fries also carbohydrate.  The potato patty taste like curry puff.  I order double by mistake. All carbohydrate will make you fat and diabetic.  I don't like this at all
